results.title: Say it with words
results.brief_description: There are important differences between writing in private and speaking in public. This program demonstrates the following skills: preparing the speech, rehearsal, and the correct use of visual aids. A humorous program with Judy McBride, David Argue, Tracy Harvey and Mark Little.

results.title: Oh, boy! Babies!
results.creator_credit: Gail Frank, Carole Hart and Laughing Willow Company
results.brief_description: An infant care class is introduced as an elective in the curriculum of an upper primary school class in an American school. One boy disinterested at first comes to enjoy his time with the babies and learns that caring and nurturing are not restricted to the female gender. Raises points for discussion re male and female roles. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Get it write
results.brief_description: A guide to writing essays, reports and projects. Emphasizes the importance of a suitable approach to the topic; careful thought and research; a step by step method of writing; and the development of logical argument.

results.title: Nasser: people's pharaoh
results.creator_credit: New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: Part of the Leaders of the twentieth century: portraits of power series. Examines Nasser’s rise to power in 1952 and his life as leader of Egypt during the 1950s and 1960s. Uses contemporary footage to provide insight into a number of events such as the Suez crisis (1956) and the Six Day War (1967). Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: De Gaulle: republican monarch
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: Part of the “Leaders of the 20th century: portraits of power” this episode begins in 1958 when Charles De Gaulle is called to lead France after a civil war. De Gaulle forms the Fifth Republic and institutes a presidential style of government for ten years bringing political, economic and financial stability to FRance until he is forced out by waves of unrest in 1968.

results.title: Churchill: voice of a prophet
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: Examines Churchill’s life immediately after the Second World War and his loss to Labour in the general election; his predictions of the dangers of the Soviet Bloc; his anti Soviet speeches throughout the USA; his visits to India in 1947 for the granting of independence; his return as Prime Minister in 1951 and his death in 1965. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Churchill: voice of a lion
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: After a brief resume of his early life this film examines Churchill’s role in the Second World War. It provides footage of his meetings with Stalin and Roosevelt and his visits to the front and is mostly concerned with his leading of the British to victory in the War. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Adenauer: Germany reborn
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: A presentation of the career of Adenauer, West Germany’s Chancellor from 1945-1963. Provides footage of the concentration camps, the Nuremburg trial, the Allied occupation of Germany, the Berlin airlift of 1948, the establishment of a new government in Bonn in 1949 and the building of the Berlin wall. Pro American narration by Henry Fonda.

results.title: Irene moves in
results.creator_credit: Kit Hood, Linda Schuyler and Playing With Time
results.brief_description: Ida resents Irene who is a newcomer to the neighbourhood and tries to prevent her from joining the secret club of which she is president. Raises issues about friendships, loyalties, and abuse of power.

results.title: Starstruck
results.creator_credit: Claude Kerven, Patrick McCormick and Highgate Pictures
results.brief_description: Depicts the conflicts faced by an adolescent girl who must choose between her dream to be a singer-song writer or living up to her mother’s hopes by following a secure but not totally satisfying career as a bookkeeper. This film would be useful for discussion of values, decision making and communication. Cast includes Trini Alvarado, Joanna Merlin. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
